sentences.chinese: 那里非常好，有趣，有很好的夜店可去。

sentences.english: Similarly, night clubs purposely make patrons wait at the door.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，夜店也会故意让常客在门口大排长龙。

sentences.english: But I think I've never been to any of the nightclubs in Camden.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没去过卡姆登的夜店。

sentences.english: These three outfits are perfect for casualwear, eveningwear and summerwear!
sentences.chinese: 这三款都适合日常穿着，夜店和夏天的打扮。

sentences.english: TS: You're hot. Ever go to bathhouses or sex clubs?
sentences.chinese: 你太性感了，有没有去过澡堂或者性爱夜店。

sentences.english: And there're loads of nightclubs around here.
sentences.chinese: 这儿附近就有很多夜店。

sentences.english: Doctor left the club alone around 3:30.
sentences.chinese: 医生大约在三点半左右独自离开了夜店。

sentences.english: There's lots of night clubs that are very big out here in Hollywood that lots of celebrities go, too.
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞这里有好多很大的夜店，名人们也去。

sentences.english: Old Street area has lots of nightclubs.
The reveling switches into high gear around midnight.
sentences.chinese: 夜店狂欢在午夜时分达到高潮。

sentences.english: Will they have casinos and night clubs?
sentences.chinese: 岛上会有赌场和夜店吗？

sentences.english: Let's say you are about to go out to a club with a bunch of friends.
sentences.chinese: 假设你准备和一群朋友一起去夜店。

definition: disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
karaoke hall/singing hall (venue for concerts of popular songs)
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
